title: Logitech G910 + LoL = beep beep DEATH. PLS SEND HALP!
body:
So i'm playing with this badass mech keyboard... and behold, in it's infinite glory... it doesn't play League of Legends very well.
Pretty sure it's to do with the Anti Ghosting.
I hold SpaceBar to center my camera... and let go when i need to scroll around. But essentially, I'm always holding down the space bar.
So if i use abilities very quickly, it seems to lock up on me, and i cant do anything for like 2 seconds, this includes moving my mouse, which does move, but in a terribly laggy way.
Has anyone found this?
I tried turning on filter keys to mess around with repeated strokes... this did not work.
Does anyone know how I can fix this, as I cant play this game with constant 2 seconds laggy bits, because my keyboard is being a dick.
Meanwhile, the old Microsoft Membrane keyboard from 1992 works freaking fine... apart from missing most of the keys...
WTF. PLS SEND HALP!

replies.body:
I'm not too versed in Logitech softwares (I myself use Tt ESPORTS, works like a charm). But a definite solution for you to try is to uninstall your mouse drivers, forcing Windows to use the generic driver (I presume you're Windows because of the Microsoft Membrane Keyboard). That's if you're okay with uninstalling the drivers, though.

If you don't want to, reply to this message saying that.

Best of luck.
Thanks Horse of Force, I will try that... I'm using a Razer Naga mouse... So I should uninstall this mouse driver?

Yes. Of course, have the installer for that driver handy,

wait

You have a Logitech Keyboard and a Razor Mouse. That right there might be your problem. I know that Logitech's drivers will install and try to discover any other Logitech devices you have connected aside from the one you installed the software for and try to take control of it. It might be taking control of your Razor mouse, hence the disastrous effects, because it's not Logitech.

Just a theory, though.

Anyway, uninstall the softwares you installed when you first got your mouse. Unless, did Windows install the drivers automatically for you?

This has definitely worked much better. From time to time, I get the beep...
But that's when i've been holding down the Space Bar for 30mins or something... LoL!

Thank YOU SO SO SO SO SO SO SO MUCH!!!!!!!!

May the Poro King Bless you Tonight, sweet Prince.
I am honoured. Have fun gaming without lag!
